intro: Cucubalus silenoides, commonly known as the silky sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale green leaves with a soft, hairy texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, round capsules as fruits. Cucubalus silenoides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas.
